discussion.content:
Answer is correct.

but typical Cisco SHIT. using the word "key" to throw you off

questions.question_text: Which Cisco Umbrella package supports selective proxy for inspection of traffic from risky domains?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: D
SIG Advantage provides selective proxy

Selected Answer: A
Umbrella DNS security advantage gives a selective proxy (intelligent proxy), and SIG advantage gives a full webproxy.

Selected Answer: A
"With selective proxy" in: 
https://learn-cloudsecurity.cisco.com/umbrella-resources/umbrella/cisco-umbrella-package-comparison-2?utm_content=cs-fy2020-q1-datasheet-cisco-umbrella-package-comparison&_gl=1*1ld966i*_gcl_aw*R0NMLjE2ODM4MTYyMjkuQ2owS0NRandwUEtpQmhEdkFSSXNBQ24tZ3pBelBRTFRCYWlNa2hOUm9aN0xUZENjZUwzbVlZYWR0blZ2d1RtMExzSzNGQXlfWTRDaGhMb2FBbnEtRUFMd193Y0I.*_gcl_dc*R0NMLjE2ODM4MTYyMjkuQ2owS0NRandwUEtpQmhEdkFSSXNBQ24tZ3pBelBRTFRCYWlNa2hOUm9aN0xUZENjZUwzbVlZYWR0blZ2d1RtMExzSzNGQXlfWTRDaGhMb2FBbnEtRUFMd193Y0I.*_gcl_au*NjUxMTUyMTc5LjE2ODM1NTAyOTQ.&_ga=2.53392296.125068341.1688848910-1813562082.1683550297

Selected Answer: D
D. SIG Advantage
"SIG Advantage provides selective proxy - Routing specific risky user or application traffic to Umbrella's cloud proxy for deeper inspection before forwarding." -Cisco Umbrella Overview, 2019
"SIG Advantage enables routing of traffic fromrisky domains or devices through the Umbrella proxy, where it can be scanned and monitored before being allowed through." -Cisco Umbrella Deployment Guide, 2020

A. DNS Security Advantage

The DNS Security Advantage package in Cisco Umbrella includes a selective proxy feature that allows for the inspection of traffic from risky domains. This feature enables organizations to route suspicious or potentially harmful traffic through a proxy for further inspection and analysis.

By leveraging the selective proxy capability, organizations can gain deeper visibility into the traffic originating from domains that pose a higher risk of security threats. This helps in detecting and mitigating potential malicious activities or data breaches.

questions.question_text: What are the two distribution methods available to an administrator when performing a fresh rollout of the Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AE
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/vpn_client/anyconnect/anyconnect40/administration/guide/b_AnyConnect_Administrator_Guide_4-0/deploy-anyconnect.html#:~:text=Endpoint%20for%20AnyConnect-,Predeploying%20AnyConnect,-Web%20Deploying%20AnyConnect

The Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client can be deployed to remote users by the following methods:

Predeploy—New installations and upgrades are done either by the end user, or by using an enterprise software management system (SMS).

Web Deploy—The AnyConnect package is loaded on the headend, which is either an ASA or FTD firewall, or an ISE server. When the user connects to a firewall or to ISE, AnyConnect is deployed to the client.

D. Cisco Cloudlock

Cisco Cloudlock: Cisco Cloudlock is a cloud-native Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB) that helps secure your cloud applications, including popular platforms like Dropbox, Office 365, Google Drive, and Salesforce. It focuses on data protection, threat protection, and compliance by monitoring and controlling data in cloud applications, ensuring that sensitive data is not exfiltrated.

questions.question_text: Which Cisco security solution integrates with cloud applications like Dropbox and Office 365 while protecting data from being exfiltrated?

An engineer must configure Cisco AMP for Endpoints so that it contains a list of files that should not be executed by users. These files must not be quarantined. Which action meets this configuration requirement?

choices.B: Add a list for simple custom detection.
choices.C: Identify the network IPs and place them in a blocked list.
choices.D: Create an application control blocked applications list.
choices.A: Modify the advanced custom detection list to include these files.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
It's correct, from OCG:
"To create a new application control list for blocking an application, navigate to Outbreak Control > Application Control > Blocked Applications. Figure 11-9 demonstrates this process. As you would expect, to create a new list, you click Create. You must name the list and click Save before you can add any applications to the blocking list."
